headline: South Australia launches first capacity tender for 700MW of long-duration energy storage
summary_80w: South Australia has officially opened its inaugural Firm Energy Reliability Mechanism (FERM) tender round, seeking up to 700MW of long-duration energy storage (LDES) capacity to enhance grid reliability and support the state's renewable energy transition.

headline: Australia: Queensland councils receive new toolkit for navigating renewable energy project assessments
summary_80w: The Queensland government has launched the Social Licence in Renewable Energy Toolkit, providing local councils in Australia with resources to navigate renewable energy project engagement and community consultation processes.

headline: 725MW of Australian solar-plus-storage projects advance in NSW and Queensland
summary_80w: Australia's solar-plus-storage sector gained momentum with 725MW of solar PV approvals advancing across New South Wales and Queensland.

headline: Global energy storage deployments on track for record year in 2025, BNEF says
summary_80w: Despite lowering its forecasts due to US-led tariff and policy disruptions, BNEF says 2025 will be a record-breaking year for energy storage.

headline: Eku Energy lodges 1,600MWh Monduran BESS for environmental assessment in Australia
summary_80w: Developer Eku Energy has submitted its 400MW/1,600MWh Monduran battery energy storage system (BESS) project for environmental assessment under Australia's Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation (EPBC) Act.

headline: Trinasolar to supply Mestron Energy with 50MW of Vertex N solar modules
summary_80w: Leading Chinese solar manufacturer Trinasolar has signed a module supply agreement with Malaysian renewable energy developer Mestron Energy.

headline: Is Europe ready to tackle solar cybersecurity risks?
summary_80w: PV Tech Premium spoke with academic and industry experts about the rising tide of cybersecurity concerns in Europe's solar energy sector.

headline: Cypress Creek Renewables reaches financial close on Colorado solar-plus-storage project
summary_80w: Cypress Creek Renewables has achieved financial close on its 75MW Sundance solar-plus-storage project in Elbert County, Colorado.

headline: AI-powered robot installers exceed targets at Engie’s 250MW solar project in Australia
summary_80w: Luminous Robotics has successfully completed its first international deployment of AI-powered solar installation robots at Engie’s 250MW Goorambat East Solar Farm in Victoria, Australia.

headline: New Zealand: 179MWdc Glorit Solar Farm clears regulatory hurdle with EPA consent
summary_80w: An independent panel has granted resource consents for the 179MW Glorit Solar Farm in Auckland, New Zealand.

headline: Ameresco, Alliant Energy, begin operating record-breaking BESS projects in Arizona, Wisconsin
summary_80w: Ameresco has put Arizona's largest behind-the-meter battery energy storage system (BESS) into operation, meanwhile Alliant Energy has begun operating Wisconsin's largest BESS to-date.

headline: Boralex progresses 500MWh Ontario BESS, prepares another 1.6GWh project for upcoming IESO LT2 RFP
summary_80w: Quebec-based IPP Boralex has received the green light from local authorities to move forward with a 125MWh/500MWh BESS located in Oxford County, Ontario.

headline: Energy Storage Awards 2025: Shortlists revealed for celebration of industry’s best and brightest
summary_80w: Leading energy storage technology companies, developers, operators and outstanding individuals are featured on the shortlists for this year’s Energy Storage Awards (ESAs).

headline: Germany and Netherlands BESS action from cross-border operators Eneco, Giga and Return
summary_80w: A flurry of BESS news from companies operating across Germany and the Netherlands, with utility Lichtblick launching construction on a 470MWh project in Saxony, Giga Storage inaugurating a project in Amsterdam, and cross-border BESS platform Return raising €300 million.

headline: Wärtsilä opts for in-house control over battery storage data analytics
summary_80w: Wärtsilä Energy Storage’s new battery data analytics software platform aims to bring in-house what has until now been the domain of third-party providers.

headline: VIDEO: Taking on the UK’s LT2029 tender and the future of grid stability services, with Envision
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news proudly presents our sponsored webinar with Envision, on the UK's LT2029 procurement and the future of grid stability services.

headline: Atlas Renewable Energy secures US$475 million for 357MW/320MW solar-plus-storage project in Chile
summary_80w: Independent power producer (IPP) Atlas Renewable Energy has secured up to US$475 million in financing for a 357MW solar-plus-storage project in Chile.

headline: AgriPV projects in Spain now eligible for farming subsidies
summary_80w: Spain has amended its national common agricultural policy (PAC) framework to include agrivoltaic (agriPV) systems to be eligible for subsidies.

headline: Data centre loads and domestic content policy define US battery storage market’s future, law firm says
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium speaks with Vaughn Morrison of law firm Troutman Pepper Locke, about the firm’s latest energy storage report.

headline: Jigar Shah chairs new US virtual power plant advisory group
summary_80w: The non-profit Energy Policy Design Institute (EPDI) has launched the Virtual Power Plant (VPP) Convergence Project, with an advisory group that includes Jigar Shah, former director of the US Department of Energy’s Loan Programs Office.

headline: Mind the gap
summary_80w: New data suggests the traditional assumptions behind hail stow modelling may be underestimating the likelihood of damage to a PV system.

headline: US policies to ‘cloud’ renewable project deployment and costs, batteries and solar to be hit hardest
summary_80w: New federal policies in the US will 'cloud' the country’s renewable energy sector, according to a webinar hosted by Wood Mackenzie.

headline: Section 232 polysilicon tariffs could be clarified by ‘end of the month’
summary_80w: Details of tariffs on US imports of polysilicon products may be announced as early as the end of this month, according to a note from investment bank Roth Capital.

headline: Bahrain launches tender for 100MW solar project
summary_80w: Bahrainian authorities are inviting initial proposals from developers to build a 100MW solar project in the country, due for commercial operation by September 2027.

headline: First ‘Made in Europe’ BESS factory opens in Bulgaria, Lyten closes Northvolt Poland acquisition
summary_80w: Production has begun at a battery energy storage system (BESS) factory designated as a project of strategic importance by the European Commission (EC) due to its use of local supply chains.

headline: How political and economic disruption is causing a rethink in solar and storage financing
summary_80w: According to Ronak Maheshwari of CRC-IB, there has been a struggle for US renewable power projects to secure necessary equity .

headline: Scatec to deploy 60MW/10MWh pre-assembled solar and storage in West Africa
summary_80w: Norwegian renewable energy firm Scatec has signed lease agreements for 64MW of solar PV and 10MWh of energy storage capacity in Liberia and Sierra Leone.

headline: Over 20 US states sue EPA over ‘illegal’ US$7 billion Solar For All cancellation
summary_80w: A group of over 20 US states are suing the Trump administration for the cancellation of the US$7 billion Solar For All Scheme.

headline: Lightshift Energy secures US$75 million for East Coast project pipeline
summary_80w: US storage and solar developer-operator Lightshift Energy, along with KeyBanc Capital Markets, have closed a US$75 million credit facility.

headline: Naturgy launches construction on first portion of ten-site, 160MW BESS portfolio in Spain
summary_80w: Utility and power firm Naturgy has started building its first BESS projects in Spain, at four solar PV plants in Almeria and the Canary Islands.

headline: EASE rebrands as Energy Storage Europe Association for era of ‘unprecedented growth’
summary_80w: European Association for Storage of Energy (EASE), which represents 70 member organisations across the industry value chain, has undergone a rebrand.

headline: Powerlink Queensland seeks federal approval for AGL’s 2GWh Tuckeroo battery transmission connection
summary_80w: Powerlink Queensland is seeking federal approval for transmission infrastructure connecting AGL Energy's 2,000MWh Tuckeroo battery energy storage system (BESS) to the Western Downs Substation in Australia.

headline: Ark Energy bags state approval for 3.1GWh Richmond Valley solar-plus-storage site in Australia
summary_80w: The New South Wales Independent Planning Commission has approved Ark Energy's 3,148MWh Richmond Valley solar-plus-storage project in Australia.

headline: Masdar, Turkey near US$1 billion deal for 1.1GW hybrid project
summary_80w: Masdar and Turkey have entered the final stage of US$1 billion agreement to develop the 1.1GW plant in Bor, Niğde Province, central Turkey.

headline: Nextracker to supply steel module frames for T1 Energy’s Dallas module manufacturing facility
summary_80w: T1 Energy and Nextracker have agreed to use the latter’s steel module frames at the former’s new 5GW module manufacturing facility in Dallas.

headline: US utility PV up 56% in 2024, accounting for 54% of all new capacity – LNBL
summary_80w: US utility-scale solar additions grew by 56% in 2024, reaching 30GW from 2023’s 19GW and representing over 54% of all new electricity generation capacity added in the country last year.

headline: Solar, wind and electrification the ‘main tools’ to improve EU energy security – Ember
summary_80w: Expanding the electrification of Europe’s energy sector, would be the 'main tool' to improve the EU’s energy security, according to Ember.

headline: Jakson, Blueleaf reach financial close for 840MWp solar projects in Rajasthan
summary_80w: Jakson Green and Blueleaf Energy have reached financial close for the 840MWp Bikaner solar projects in Rajasthan, western India.

headline: Off-grid solar specialist Sun King unveils African manufacturing plans
summary_80w: Off-grid solar company Sun King has revealed plans to set up manufacturing operations in Kenya and Nigeria.

headline: SB Energy receives CEC grant to purchase Fluence batteries for portion of 1.6GWh Riverside County BESS
summary_80w: Utility-scale developer SB Energy has received a US$25 million grant from the California Energy Commission (CEC) to purchase BESS units for one of its solar and storage hybrid complexes located in Riverside County, California.

headline: Fluence supplies US-made BESS solution to 640MWh project in Arizona
summary_80w: Fluence has announced a solar-plus-storage project in Arizona, while Greenflash Infrastructure adds to its Texas BESS portfolio.

headline: ‘There will be incidents’: Fire safety risk mitigation, public perception and design factors in BESS asset management
summary_80w: How you approach fire safety risk management in BESS was a big talking point yesterday at the Battery Asset Management Summit UK & Ireland 2025.

headline: Chile to reach 2050 energy storage target within next two years, says energy minister
summary_80w: During the opening address of Energy Storage Summit Latin America 2025, in Santiago, Chile, the Chilean Minister of Energy Diego Pardow Lorenzo said the country was most likely set to surpass its 2050 targets in 2027.

headline: State government, project partners inaugurate Germany’s first utility-scale grid-forming BESS
summary_80w: The first large-scale battery energy storage system (BESS) with grid-forming capabilities in Germany was inaugurated a few days ago.

headline: Octopus Australia acquires 400MWh Coleambally battery project in New South Wales
summary_80w: Octopus Australia has acquired the Coleambally battery energy storage system (BESS), a 100MW/400MWh standalone project in development located in southern New South Wales.

headline: Spanish utility Iberdrola acquires 1GWh Tungkillo battery storage project in South Australia
summary_80w: Spanish utility Iberdrola has acquired the 270MW/1,080MWh Tungkillo battery energy storage system (BESS) in South Australia from RES Group.

headline: North American solar PPA prices up 4% in Q3 amid ‘policy headwinds’
summary_80w: The average price of a solar PPA signed in North America increased 4% between the second and third quarters of 2025, according to LevelTen.

headline: Ciel & Terre pitches new floating PV system for GW-scale projects
summary_80w: Ciel & Terre has launched a new floating PV structure designed to address the increasingly large scale of floating solar projects.

headline: SINEXCEL’s Silicon Carbide Edge: A Decade of US Market Experience Meets Next-Generation Power Electronics
summary_80w: At RE+ 2025, the Chinese energy solution provider discusses modular design innovations, efficiency gains, and navigating an uncertain policy landscape.

headline: Copper demand set to surge 24% by 2035 as energy transition accelerates
summary_80w: Wood Mackenzie has warned of a supply bottleneck as the renewable energy shift drives a spike in global copper demand over the next decade.

headline: Major acceleration in renewables deployment needed to hit 11.2TW 2030 target – report
summary_80w: A report by IRENA and others has highlighted the need for yearly renewable energy deployments to almost double between now and 2030.

headline: Geronimo expands US portfolio with 275MW solar projects in Illinois and Michigan
summary_80w: Independent power producer (IPP) Geronimo has begun construction on it’s150MW solar project in Illinois and commissioned the 125MW PV project in Michigan.

headline: Saatvik Green Energy receives module orders worth US$78 million
summary_80w: Indian module manufacturer Saatvik Green Energy, through its subsidiary Saatvik Solar Industries, has secured solar PV module orders worth INR6.89 billion (US$78 million).

headline: Australian government approves 141MW solar PV power plant in just 19 days
summary_80w: The Australian government has approved the 141MW Forbes Solar Farm Project in New South Wales in just 19 days, marking one of the fastest environmental approvals on record in the country.

headline: Australia opens Capacity Investment Scheme Tender 7, seeking 5GW of renewables
summary_80w: Australia has opened registrations for Capacity Investment Scheme (CIS) Tender 7, which targets 5GW of renewable energy generation capacity across the National Electricity Market (NEM).

headline: US ROUNDUP: ESS Inc LDES pilot, investments in Energy Vault, NineDot
summary_80w: Energy storage developers are securing significant capital and strategic partnerships, with ESS Inc launching a 50MWh iron flow battery pilot, Energy Vault closing a US$300 million investment, and NineDot obtaining US$175 million in debt financing.

headline: Long-term risk, KPIs and the value of developers and optimisers in BESS asset management
summary_80w: The value of developers and optimisers in the BESS lifecycle, thinking about long-term risk and KPIs for maximising the asset have been key themes at the Battery Asset Management Summit UK & Ireland 2025.

headline: US energy storage industry sees data centre load growth as bridge to low-carbon energy transition
summary_80w: The US administration has a clear distaste for climate issues, but economics and data centres can still drive a clean energy transition.

headline: BESS projects totalling over 1.5GWh progress in Bulgaria, Romania, Finland and Greece
summary_80w: A flurry of grid-scale BESS project progress totalling more than a combined 1.5GWh in the past week, from Renalfa in Bulgaria, Engie in Romania, Nala Renewables in Finland and Metlen in Greece.

headline: Chile to hit 2030 energy storage target early, Argentina entices investors: Energy Storage Summit Latin America Day 1
summary_80w: Takeaways from the first day of Energy Storage Summit Latin America 2025, including the Chilean and Argentinian markets.

headline: CleanCo Queensland’s 500MWh Tesla Megapack BESS at former coal site enters commissioning in Australia
summary_80w: Publicly-owned energy company CleanCo Queensland's 250MW/500MWh Swanbank battery energy storage system (BESS) has officially registered with AEMO and commenced its testing and commissioning phase.

headline: Apple to back 650MW of European renewable projects in US$600M push
summary_80w: Apple will support 650MW of projects as part of a major expansion of its renewable energy investments in Europe, aimed at reducing its carbon footprint.

headline: Eolian secures US$463 million for 1.7GWh Texas BESS complex
summary_80w: IPP Eolian has closed a US$463 million financing package to support the continued construction of Padua 2 and Padua 3, two battery energy storage systems (BESS) totalling 350MW/1.7GWh in Bexar County, Texas.

headline: Chile: Grenergy breaks ground on newest solar-plus-storage hybrid in 1.1GW/3.8GWh portfolio
summary_80w: Spanish IPP Grenergy has begun construction on a 340MW solar project with 960MWh of energy storage in El Cabrero, located in Chile’s Biobío region.

headline: Solar PV curtailment in Chile keeps growing in 2025 – ACERA
summary_80w: The curtailment of solar PV and wind capacity in Chile has reached 3.2TWh as of August 2025, a slight increase from the same period in 2024.

headline: OCI Holdings Vietnam wafer play exposes critical US solar supply bottleneck
summary_80w: OCI Holdings’ decision this week to buy a Vietnamese solar wafer facility to supply the US solar cell manufacturing industry makes clear the biggest vulnerability facing the sector today.

headline: PV CellTech USA takeaways: Perovskite, manufacturing bottlenecks and tariffs dominate discussions
summary_80w: Perovskite, tariffs, Section 232 and FEOC were among the key topics discussed at PV CellTech USA this year in San Francisco.

headline: German IPP wpd starts construction at 140MW French solar project
summary_80w: German IPP wpd has started construction at its 140.6MW Marcy solar park in the Nièvre department of central France.

headline: Levanta Renewables to build 166MWp solar-plus-storage project in Philippines
summary_80w: Levanta Renewables will develop a 166MWp ground-mounted solar and storage project in the Visayas Islands as part of the Philippines’ Fourth Green Energy Auction.

headline: India adds 4.9GW residential rooftop solar in H1
summary_80w: India has installed 4.9GW of residential rooftop solar capacity in the first half of 2025, according to a report by IEEFA and JMK Research.

headline: PJM area faces urgent energy storage need, US Energy Storage Coalition reports
summary_80w: According to a new report from the US Energy Storage Coalition (ESC), PJM faces an urgent near-term requirement for affordable capacity to accommodate large loads expected through 2032.

headline: Germany BESS platform Terra One: ‘The delta between merchant and tolling is big’
summary_80w: We catch up with the CFO and co-founder of German BESS own-operate platform Terra One, after its €150 million (US$173 million) mezzanine financing to scale up in Europe's hottest energy storage market.

headline: Kyoto Group’s 56MWh thermal energy storage system replaces natural gas at corn processing plant in Hungary
summary_80w: Thermal energy storage (TES) technology company Kyoto Group’s latest project will displace the use of natural gas at a corn processing plant in Hungary, Europe.

headline: Epic Energy brings 200MWh Mannum battery storage system online in South Australia
summary_80w: Developer Epic Energy has commenced commercial operations at its 100MW/200MWh Mannum battery energy storage system (BESS) in South Australia.

headline: ‘NEM-specific battery optimisers’ capture more revenue during the market volatility around AU$20,300/MWh NSW price spike
summary_80w: Battery storage equipped with optimisation platforms not specifically designed for Australia's NEM missed revenue opportunities during the 10 October price spike, according to Sahand Karimi, co-founder and CEO of OptiGrid.

headline: Grenergy breaks ground on 340MW solar, 960MWh BESS project under Chile’s Central Oasis platform
summary_80w: Grenergy has begun construction on a 340MW solar project with 960MWh of energy storage in El Cabrero, located in Chile’s Biobío region.

headline: Akaysha Energy’s Waratah Super Battery discharges its first full output to Australia’s NEM
summary_80w: Australia’s most powerful BESS, the 850MW Waratah Super Battery, achieved its first full discharge to the NEM last week.

headline: Engie and Masdar win bid for 1.5GW Abu Dhabi PV project
summary_80w: France’s Engie and the UAE’s Masdar have been chosen to jointly develop a 1.5GW PV power plant near Abu Dhabi.

headline: Slashing utility-scale grading costs: a hidden lever for optimising ROI
summary_80w: Brett Beattie of Castillo Engineering looks at some of the key land grading work that can make multimillion-dollar differences to projects.

headline: OCI Holdings eyeing US market with 65% stake in 2.7GW Vietnamese solar wafer plant
summary_80w: Korean chemical production firm OCI Holdings has acquired a 65% stake in a Vietnamese solar wafer production plant, intending to export solar wafers to the US.

headline: Solar power’s ‘meteoric’ rise, growth of distributed solar and battery co-location among key DNV energy trends
summary_80w: The world is on pace to exceed 3TW of cumulative solar installations by the end of the year, according to a report from DNV.

headline: US quietly cancels 6.2GW Nevada solar project
summary_80w: The Trump administration has cancelled the 6.2GW Esmeralda 7 solar project in Nevada – once touted as one of the largest in the world.

headline: PowerChina and Energy China sign Saudi PV and wind contracts totalling 7GW
summary_80w: Two Chinese state-owned energy enterprises have signed cooperation agreements on PV and wind power projects with Saudi companies, with the total contract value exceeding RMB30 billion (US$4.2 billion).

headline: SEIA wins approval for US solar transparency standard
summary_80w: ANSI has approved a new traceability standard proposed by the SEIA to improve transparency of the solar and storage supply chain.

headline: T1 Energy buys minority stake in Talon PV in big move for US solar cell manufacturing
summary_80w: US solar manufacturer T1 Energy has acquired a minority stake in fellow US-based solar cell producer Talon PV.

headline: Base Power raises US$1 billion for residential energy storage systems
summary_80w: Residential energy storage startup Base Power has raised US$1 billion in Series C financing from venture capital fund Addition.

headline: Hithium ‘actively preparing resubmission’ for Hong Kong IPO
summary_80w: Chinese lithium-ion OEM Hithium will push forward with its planned IPO on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (HKEX).

headline: Global grid-scale BESS deployments up 36% in first nine months of 2025
summary_80w: A total of 49.4GW/136.5GWh of grid-scale BESS came online in the first nine months of the year, up 36% compared to the same period in 2024.

headline: Queensland’s Energy Roadmap: 4.3GW of short-duration energy storage by 2030, pumped hydro plans revised
summary_80w: Queensland's Energy Roadmap 2025 suggests that by 2030, up to 4.3GW of short-duration energy storage could be operational.

headline: New South Wales electricity prices hit AU$20,300/MWh cap as battery storage captures volatility
summary_80w: On 10 October, electricity prices in New South Wales, Australia, reached the Market Price Cap of AU$20,300/MWh (US$13,307/MWh).

headline: Germany: Federal Network Agency picks 490MW of solar-plus-storage from oversubscribed tender
summary_80w: Germany has awarded contracts to 490MW of solar-plus-storage projects in its latest “innovation” auction for co-located renewables.

headline: ‘The industry is producing more than it can install,’ says Gaëtan Masson as world exceeds 2.2TW of solar
summary_80w: Gaëtan Masson of IEA PVPS warns of overcapacity, collapsing prices and slipping module quality in the new Trends in PV Applications report.

headline: European solar module market reaches supply and price ‘equilibrium’
summary_80w: The European solar module market has reached a “state of equilibrium” in recent weeks, with stable prices and regular demand.

headline: Solar recycling firm OnePlanet awarded R2v3 traceability standard
summary_80w: US solar recycling firm OnePlanet has achieved the R2v3 certification from electronics sustainability non-profit SERI, which represents the “highest standards of traceability”.

headline: NTPC Green signs MoU with Gujarat government to develop 15GW renewable energy projects
summary_80w: NTPC Renewable Energy Limited has signed an MoU with the Government of Gujarat to develop 15GW renewable energy projects in Gujarat.

headline: US ROUNDUP: Cross-industry collaborations target energy storage growth and accessibility
summary_80w: Honeywell, LS Electric, esVolta, Sitetracker, PairedPower, PHNXX, and Energy Toolbase are collaborating on new initiatives to advance energy storage installations across the US.

headline: UK BESS asset management has moved to ‘disciplined, systems-level approach’
summary_80w: BESS asset management in the UK has moved beyond the rudimentary 'project delivery and basic O&M' approach, a speaker at the upcoming Battery Asset Management Summit UK & Ireland explained in a Q&A.

headline: India’s H1 energy storage installations plunge 74% year-on-year to 49MWh: Mercom
summary_80w: According to the latest report by clean energy market research firm Mercom India, India achieved a cumulative energy storage capacity of 490MWh by the end of June 2025.

headline: Texas utility signs 200MWh BESS offtake agreement with Jupiter Power to combat ERCOT duck curve
summary_80w: Community-owned public power utility Denton Municipal Electric (DME) has signed a power purchase agreement (PPA) with Jupiter Power covering offtake from one of the developer-operator's standalone BESS projects destined for Robertson County in Texas.

headline: NSW Independent Planning Commission approves ACEnergy’s 1,100MWh battery storage system in Australia
summary_80w: The New South Wales Independent Planning Commission has approved ACEnergy's 250MW/1,100MWh Yanco battery energy storage system in Australia.
